metadata.deliveryMethod: Delivered by snowy owl familiar to the Northlook Inn

paragraphs.text: I trust this missive finds you well-rested after your eventful journey from {location:east_haven}. Word travels quickly through {location:bryn_shander}, and your party's heroic escort of seven hundred refugees has not gone unnoticed. The town buzzes with tales of your group's valor against the vampire-yeti assault.

Following our meeting in {location:bryn_shander}, I took the liberty of returning to the battlefield to retrieve the vampire brides' remains for study. Such specimens rarely present themselves for examination, and I suspect their condition may reveal crucial intelligence about the undead threat we face.

The magical theorist in me is absolutely fascinated by your acquisition of those {item:netherese_stones} from {location:targos}. The stones you carry represent some of the most sophisticated enchantment work from the fallen empire—devices capable of anchoring tremendous magical energies to specific locations.
Your visit to {location:black_iron_blades} was quite the spectacle, I'm told. The transformation of that {item:dragon_heart} into those rather impressive bracers must have been remarkable to witness.

I would be most interested to hear your firsthand account of the audience with Speaker {character:duvessa}, particularly regarding the political maneuvering you witnessed. My sources suggest {character:naerth}'s presence complicated matters considerably.

Your party's newfound wealth—ten thousand gold in diamonds, I hear—positions you perfectly for the challenges ahead. Though I suspect you view my research with distaste, the practical applications of necromantic knowledge may prove essential in dealing with both the undead threat at {location:reghed_glacier} and our upcoming rendezvous with your {character:illithid} acquaintance.

signature.name: Vellynne Harpell
signature.title: Tenth Black Staff of Blackstaff Academy

content.postscript: I've heard remarkable things about a new three-armed fighting technique. Such adaptability in combat suggests you're becoming more comfortable with unconventional solutions—a promising development for what lies ahead.
